thread.title: Lib Dem leader Sir Vince visiting Devon

author: Tina Crowson
title: Lib Dem leader Sir Vince visiting Devon
text:
Lib Dem leader Sir Vince visiting Devon He will be in South Devon and Exeter Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Share 
Liberal Democrat leader Sir Vince Cable is visiting Devon. The former Coalition Secretary of State for Business Innovation and Skills and the new leader of the Liberal Democrats will be taking breakfast with Torbay business people. 
Sir Vince will be guest at a special Torbay Business Forum breakfast meeting on Friday October 27 from 7.30am to 9am at the Riviera International Conference Centre in Torquay. Read More 
He will also be visiting the South Devon UTC in Kingsteignton Road designed to give students the skills needed by local businesses. Sir Vince Cable (Image: Liberal Democrats) 
After that he will be visiting Exeter Science Park. 
Tim Godfrey chairman of Torbay Business Forum, said: “We were honoured to be asked to host the Torbay leg of Sir Vince Cable's visit to the South West by Devon and Cornwal Business Council. Our mantra is bringing businesses together and with Sir Vince’s stint as former Secretary of State for Business, Innovation and Skill, we will be hoping for his insight into Brexit and how this might impact on the local economy. Read More Residents' concerns about plans for £70m retirement village 
"After all as leader of the Liberal Democrats he will be standing for Prime Minister at the next election and Torbay was a Lib Dem seat for many years.”
